It belongs to the family Solanaceae, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or sandy soils, and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are generally narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces small, berry-like fruits that are edible but not widely cultivated. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
